c74object.name: hirt.convolver~
c74object.description: The HIRT Convolver offers high-quality convolution using Impulse Responses. Drop an impulse (or a single channel of a true stereo impulse stored as two stereo files) to load it into the convolution engine. Offline control is offered over the decay time and size of the virtual image. The width o f the convolved image and levels can be controlled in realtime. The Convolver also features a realtime predelay time for using it as a reverb engine, and a realtime routable EQ with Saturation options for sonic shaping. The abstraction is a good example of advanced use of the HIRT externals collection.

inlet.description: Left Audio Signal to be convolved / Messages to hirt.convolver~
Right Audio Signal to be convolved / Messages to hirt.convolver~

outlet.digest: Multiple messages, corresponding to the various input and attribute messages above
outlet.description: A direct feed from the dumpout of the internal pattrstorage object. Any internal parameter can be queried and returned here, as well as current state and storage data.

objarg.name: convolvername
objarg.digest: Set the name of this instance of the convolver
objarg.description:
Setting the name is optional. If set, the name will be displayed in the convolver User Interface. Setting the name enables remote control of any internal parameter of hirt.convolver~ using messages to Max.
The name is also given to the globalpatchername attribute of the abstraction enabling targeting by custom pattr systems. (For addressing multiple instances simultaneously one can use the special global namespace hirt.convolver).
Remote control can only address convolver parameters, not the internal pattrstorage (for pattrstorage targeting use inlets).

method.name: anything
method.description: The abstraction also accepts any message to pattrstorage for setting, querying and dealing with storage options. All pattrstorage messages can be used, and all attributes can be used apart from greedy, notifymode & parameter_enable.

method.name: close
method.description: The symbol close (or wclose) will cause the currently open UI editor window to close.

method.name: iradd
method.description:
The symbol iradd alone causes a file browser window to open for selecting a new impulse response file for loading into the convolution engine. Adding an IR with this message is identical to drag & drop in the interface or using the file attribute.
Note: when adding a set of stereo or true stereo IRs, only one of the associated files need be added - other files will be parsed automatically.

method.name: irfolder
method.digest: Address folder menu by integer index
method.description:
Syntax: irfolder <int: index>
The IR library is arranged into folders in the HIRT Package. The IR menu below it shows items in the selected folder. If a sample is dropped onto the wave display (or using iradd), the folder where that sample came from is added to the bottom of this folder menu. With the irfolder message one can address the menu items in the folder menu by zero-indexed integer.
The current state of the menu can only be infered from the user interface, but the initial items will always be constant (the factory folders).
See also the file attribute.

method.name: irmenu
method.digest: Address IR menu by integer index
method.description:
Syntax: irmenu <int: index>
Select an IR from the list in the current folder. With the irmenu message one can address the menu items in the IR menu by zero-indexed integer.
The current state of the menu can be infered from the user interface, but for the factory content these are constants.
See also the file attribute.

method.name: open
method.description: The symbol open (or front) will cause the UI editor window to open.

method.name: signal
method.digest: In either inlet: The Audio signals to be convolved
method.description: In the Left inlet: The Left signal to be convolved. In the Right inlet: The Right signal to be convolved.

attribute.name: decay
attribute.description: Offline. Internally generates a new IR with an envelope to increase or decrease the decay time in percent. This can be used for example to create a room out of a hall or to extend the length of the tail.

attribute.name: drywet
attribute.description: Adjusts the balance between the input signal (dry) and the processed signal (wet). Set this to 100 percent when the reverb is used like a return track insert.

attribute.name: eq
attribute.description:
EQ Off/On - Choose routing of EQ in DSP chain.
OFF (0) - no EQ, also CPU disables this section.
PRE (1) - pre early convolution signal.
POST (2) - post late convolution signal.

attribute.name: eqfreq1
attribute.description: Sets the center frequency of the Lowshelf filter.

attribute.name: eqfreq2
attribute.description: Sets the center frequency of the Bell filter.

attribute.name: eqfreq3
attribute.description: Sets the center frequency of the Highshelf filter.

attribute.name: eqgain1
attribute.description: Adjusts the amount of boost or attenuation of the Lowshelf filter. Rolling-off low frequencies can prevent muddy reverb.

attribute.name: eqgain2
attribute.description: Adjusts the amount of boost or attenuation of the Bell Filter.

attribute.name: eqgain3
attribute.description: Adjusts the amount of boost or attenuation of the Highshelf filter. Adjusting the Highshelf gain can make the reverb brighter or duller.

attribute.name: eqq2
attribute.description: Adjusts the Bandwidth of the Bell filter. Moderate to lower settings sound more natural.

attribute.name: eqslope1
attribute.description: Adjusts the Slope of the Lowshelf filter. Moderate to lower settings sound more natural.

attribute.name: eqslope3
attribute.description: Adjusts the Resonance of the Highshelf filter. Moderate to lower settings sound more natural.

attribute.name: file
attribute.description: Load a new IR file by file name (if file present in your search path) or by file path/name (if file outside your search path). Must be a symbol, so use "quotes" if there are spaces. Note: when adding a set of stereo or true stereo IRs, only one of the associated files need be added - other files will be parsed automatically.

attribute.name: gain
attribute.description: Adjust the output volume of the wet portion of the mix.

attribute.name: predelay
attribute.digest: Pre early reflection delay time onset
attribute.description:
Useful if using the hirt.convolver~ as a reverb. Controls the delay time, in milliseconds, before the onset of the first early reflection.
One's impression of the distance from any walls, e.g. the size of a room, depends partially on this delay. Typical values for natural sounds range from 1ms to 25ms.

attribute.name: label
attribute.value: Pre early reflection delay time onset

attribute.name: saturation
attribute.description:
Choose Saturation algorithm.
'Off' (0) is bypassed in terms of audio-chain and CPU usage (default).
'Type I' (1) is a subtle classic tanh-like analog saturator.
'Type II' (2) is an agressive waveshaper, best used for special effects rather than clean processing.
Both Saturators are inside the EQ audio path and respond to changes in filter section Gains.

attribute.name: size
attribute.description: Offline. Internally generates a new IR by resampling. Larger sizes have a longer time and darker sound. Smaller sizes become brighter, shorter and more focused.

attribute.name: width
attribute.description: Adjusts the stereo width of the Wet signal. With 0 percent, the wet signal is mono. With 100 percent the original image is preserved. Wet signals with wider images stand out in a mix more. Wet signals with a mono image blend into a mix more.

c74object.discussion: Based on the original Ableton 'Convolution Reverb' device programmed by Alex Harker. 2018 MSP port by Pete Dowling. To explore the abstraction either right-click an instantiated abstraction and choose "Object > Open Original...", or open the original '.maxpat' from the Max Browser. After this, cmnd/ctrl-e to go into edit mode, then cmnd/ctrl-click the "View" button.
